page.title: 07The River Fal : Morphology
page.content: The River Fal is a 4th order river in this D-block.The river channel was measured North of the bridge at Golden Mill. This part of the stream is a gentle meander and its grid reference is 929467 on the O.S. map. The area of the cross-section of this part of the river was 1.1sq.m (June) but the cross-section area at bankfull stage was 24.6sq.m. The maximum depth was 0.31m,the velocity was 1.1m/s and the discharge was 1.2 cubic metres per second. Bedload was randomly sampled across the channel. The middle axis (width) of stones ranged from 1cm-12cm,the average size being between 5cm and 6cm. The mineral deposits taken in solution in parts per million are as follows:zinc 0.02,sodium 25.7, iron .6 calcium 9.6,magnesium 58,water's pH7.4
